result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Sroka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit to be provided by 7/29/2022.
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
07/28/2022 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS 161 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF REVOKED FROM PROBATION.
Must report to DOC today to sign up for probation.

miscConds.notes: Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail today, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Sroka

10:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas A Sroka in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Nicholas A Sroka. 

10:29  Court relates and gives appearances.
10:30  Court questions Atty. Davis regarding PSI
10:30  State relates and gives recommendation.
10:34  Atty. Davis relates.
10:41  Nicholas makes statement.
10:42  Court relates.

Count #1: 
Imposed and stayed:  6 years and zero months Wisconsin Prison System (3 years and zero months initial confinement; 3 years and zero months of extended supervision); Dodge Correctional is reception facility.
3 years probation (credit for time served to be provided to Clerk by 07/29/2022)  - report to DOC today to sign up for probation.
Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP and substance abuse program.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
Successfully complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up ordered by PO.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail today to submit DNA sample. 
Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
Written explanation of determinate sentence given.
Voters rights ineligibility given.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

8:14 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas A Sroka appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Nicholas A Sroka. Court relates. Attorney Davis relates and requests bond be reinstated so the Defendant may continue with with requirements for Polk County case. State relates and indicates this was the intent of the State that bond continue. Previous bond was a $1000.00 cash bond. Court orders a $1000.00 signature bond.  Must report to Rice Lake DOC to start the PSI process upon release from custody. 

Address/Phone updated.
